Replies.Reply: Hey... You're gonna do great.
The Eisenhower suite. Dr. and Mrs. Harris.
What do you mean the suite may not be available?
But we confirmed two months ago.
Excuse me... do I know you?
And just who might 'you' be?
This is a... misunderstanding.
What are you talking about... ?
joke about what?
No. I have no idea what you've been through.
Are you ready...?
Are you ready... ?
Take your time, I want to see the zoo anyway.
I love the Polar Bears...
What are you doing here?
You're crazy -- you have to leave me alone.
.How did you find me --
I can't...
. can't get out. Can't leave.
I... I can't answer that.
No! They'll kill us both!
Please. Not now. Not until we're safe. Then I'll explain everything, I promise. All I want is for us to get out alive.
Your case.
Your briefcase. It got left behind. At the airport. That's why you were going back there.
I love you.
Are you ready...?
Your highness... we're honored you could attend this evening.
.I didn't realize the girls were coming this evening.
Let me take these...
Of course...
Checking on your baby again?
Why don't you just wear it? As a nerdy accessory? Here, turn around.
There. Perfect.
Stop the timer. I'll finish it.
Oh thank God you're here!

Hello, Martin. I just placed a gun in your jacket pocket. One bullet. There's really only one person, one right way to kill Bressler now, isn't there? The crazy man whose been stalking him, the crazy man who pretended to be Martin Harris...
Oh, and after you've shot him, point the gun at the Police.
God you're weak. The 'Martin' I knew wouldn't have been able to go on living like you are.
I'll kill them all. Bressler, the girls... your new girlfriend, and whoever tries to stop me.
Ooops, bet you wish you could explain that. Time's up, Martin.
.Hello, Martin.
Be careful, that might go off.
Five years as a team... and you end it like this.
You know, working with you... it almost wasn't work. We were so good... You, were so good. At the job. At other things...
Don't you want to know your real name?
'Liz?'... Don't you want to know y real name? Don't you still want... me?
A soft distance in her face. A small hole in her chest, just below her beautiful collar bone. Her eyes find him, focus, smile...
You'll never know. You'll never know who you are...
I'll do this. You check in.
How much do we owe you?
No, this is our first visit to Berlin. We're --
Tegel airport. Arrivals. Quick.
.I wouldn't know. First time.
I think you missed...
What do you do, when you're not...?
Sorry, I didn't mean anything --
They say your whole life flashes before you... but it's the little things... the details... the moments. Its like looking at a painting. Stand close, all you can see are the brush strokes.
I... I don't... speak German...
. American...
S.
Martin... Harris. Doctor...
My wife.. ?
Where's my wife? Liz...? Is she hurt? Where is she --?!
Thanksgiving... but my wife...
Oh, Jesus... Liz doesn't know...
Yes... yes, she does... it's... I can't remember...
Thanksgiving. You told me that.
Yes, yes... okay.
My wife...? Meine Frau... ?
.She gave it to me, our anniversary.
Hotel Imperial... I'm here for the Forum...
Doctor! Please, get the Doctor.
Doctor, I've been gone for four days. My wife is out there, in a city she doesn't know. She must be terrified... I need to find her before --
Yes, fine, but look, I know her.
.Liz?
Liz! I'm here, I...
My wife... Meine Frau... I'm looking for Mrs. Harris...
No... I mean yes...
I don't have it with me. My name's Harris, Dr. Martin Harris.
I'm trying to find her. I've been in the hospital.
I've already told this gentleman, I've been in the hospital. I was in an accident...
Professor Bressler!
That's Professor Bressler, right there. He knows me, he can confirm who I am.
No, I'm done being patient...
That's her, that's my wife. Over there. By the buffet table.
Seeing her. The look on his face. Processing... an overwhelming mixture of confusion and relief.
That's her. That's Liz, my wife.
Look I have been missing for four days and she has no idea what happened to me! So you need to take me to her, right now.
Liz...
Oh, Jesus Liz, I --
Liz, I... I was in an accident.
Liz...? Please. It's me.
It's me. Martin. Your husband.
Is this some kind of a joke?
-- because it really isn't funny.
Do you have any idea what I've been through?
I've been in the hospital for four days! Where were you? Were you even trying to find me --?!
-- who the hell are you!?
You. Whatever you think you're doing, you need to stop it.
Liz, please. This is...
Get out of my way --!
Liz --! Please...
Great! That's the first good idea anyone's had. Call the police. Call the God damn Army!
It's not funny. I was hurt...
There! Right there!
That's Liz, and I... I must have been outside, I... I can't remember.
He's not Martin Harris. I am Martin Harris. The man downstairs is pretending to be me.
He's forcing her... he must have--
This... this is insane.
My lab number... at Dartmouth...
it's Thanksgiving... no one's going to be there till Monday...
Professor Bressler, talk to him.
But it has!... That man has taken everything from me, don't you see? You have to arrest him...
She is my wife!
I'm sorry, I didn't realize this was funny to you.
I told you, I was in an accident.
Oh God... You're going to arrest me. You're going to --
I'm sorry... you're probably right.
I... the accident. I haven't been remembering things, very well. Perhaps this is just...
This is my doctor, at the hospital. He warned me this might happen. I should go back there. I'm really embarrassed...
I... I don't know.
Please, I won't be any more trouble. You can call the doctor. Please.
His gaze FIXED on them as the cab starts to move again...
Wait! Stop! I've changed my mind...
Rodney it's me, Martin. Rod, I'm in Berlin for the conference, but it's Liz. She's... I'm in trouble, Rod...
Are you going to give up?
okay. Solve the problem...
Can I help you? Hello?
So. I'm guessing he doesn't know where she is.
Please thank him for his time.
You know where she is. You paused. I could tell.
Please, I just want to thank her.
I thought, maybe she could use my help. Maybe I could give her some money...
I just want to thank her.
Martin. Martin Harris.
You remember me. You know who I am.
I was in your taxi.

Your friend, Biko.
It's not his fault. I told him I had money for you.
No. I mean, not now. I --

Please. Listen to me, I've been in the hospital, since the accident. My memory, it's... I don't remember what happened but something is going on and there are some people I need you to speak to. I need you to tell them what happened.
Look, things have been happening to me. I think I'm being followed.
You're my only link to before everything went...
Yes, crazy... but it's true.
You have to help me --
You're not listening to me --
But you know who I am.
Martin Harris, Doctor M --
Where was I going? In the taxi?
But I'd just arrived. It doesn't make any sense...
You got hurt, too. In the crash.
Thank you. For saving my life.
No. You can't be sure how you'll act. Not until something like that happens.
No. You don't understand. As I explained to the last guar -- who went home by the way -- it's not about Credit Cards. Someone has taken over my identity. Someone is pretending to be me. Here.
Yes. They... They believe the other man. I need a new passport, papers to prove --
Because... Because my wife. He's staying with my wife. They must be forcing her --
You don't think I know how it sounds? Let me ask you this, if my wife was having some hot and heavy affair with another man, why not just leave me? Why this?
Look, I need a passport.
I need the documents that this embassy is supposed to provide.
Monday?! They've kidnappedmy wife. You need to find out who this other man is, you need to be in contact with my wife --
I have a meeting with Bressler...
Never mind. You've been very unhelpful. Earlier a woman yelled at me because I had it so easy... being an American. Have a nice day...
Dr. Martin Harris. The professor knows who I am. We scheduled this meeting weeks ago.
Well, we haven't met, but we've been corresponding. He invited me here to discuss my thesis.
Is there some sort of problem?
Professor Bressler...
It's all right, Professor...
Professor. He is not Martin Harris. I am Martin Harris.
I called the police, you sonofabitch --!
Drakea Drakensis... Miss Drake was wrong...
A single insect was attracted, but she couldn't see it. It's too small and it moves too fast.
We talked... you and I... on the phone...
we discussed your interest in alternative forms of propagation.
I said I'd like to do the same for my kids. You talked about your children... Two girls... right? Yeah... their --
You... you told me their names...
No! That wasn't you. Don't you remember? We spoke of how brave our wives were to marry ---
-- our honeymoon in Paris. My wife and I. Liz wanted to go to the museums. All I wanted to do was visit the --
I... this isn't happening...
I... I'm... He's not...
Doctor... Do you know what it feels like, to become insane?
I can tell you.
It's like a war, between what you know...
.and what you believe.
.who do you think wins?

his mind struggles to compute. The sudden overwhelming realization that he's not insane. This man is HERE. His eyes DART as the other orderly glances over, the man from the train tunnel. Call him SMITH. He smiles at Martin, polite, nondescript. Ghostly in his disinterest.

. pulls himself upright. Tries to stand, but his body is like Jello. Reaches out, grabs the leg of a steel equipment trolley which TEETERS... CRASHES to the floor, showering Martin with a CASCADE of instruments and dressings.
It's okay... I'm fine...
That's where Spiegler worked for you? The secret police?
I always have it with me. It was a gift from my father...
No. It's my wife's handwriting.
My schedule... for this week.
My friend Rodney Cole told us to go, said it was a blast.
Professor Bressler. He knows everything...
They tried to kill me.
Do you believe me?
of money... ?
It's all I have. I'll pay you in cash as soon as I can.
Thank you.
I'm sorry. Please. I had nowhere else to go...
I just need to know. The man you picked up, the man who's life you saved. That was me, right? It was me.
I... don't know.
Can you imagine what it's like, to wake up one day, and your life... has been erased.
Thank you.
.Five years.
Yale... I was a teaching assistant. Liz heard me lecture.

I'd still have my memories.
Thank you.
Oh. I'm sorry, I just... I'm sorry. Did you do these?
No, you're right...
I'm sorry. They're beautiful.
Your eyes... It's the one thing I remember about the accident.
I'm... I'm just going... in here.
No, look!
We have to go up...
The keys. Where are the keys?
C'mon. C'mon...
C'mon...!
Gina...
.Yes. I think so... I don't remember... how it felt exactly.
.For the same reason I would.
I keep having a dream. Liz is in the bedroom of our home, although it's different somehow. Her hair's different... she's smiling, about to say something.
I just can't remember... how I felt.
You'll need to get out of town.
We're you...
I won't let anything happen to you.
I'll protect you.
Thank you for coming.
I... I didn't do it.

These numbers, are a code. The first number refers to the page of a given book. The second to a specific line on that page. The third number to words on that line. If I didn't have the exact edition of the book, the code would be unbreakable.
That's where it breaks down --
"The role of Gorytini and Thynnidae in Drakea pollination."
Correct. Yes. Look --
Fahad's sponsoring the Forum, Bressler's the keynote speaker.
In a way... they're opposites.
They're both progressives. Fahad knows we'll need food long after oil. New agricultural patents are worth billions...
He's got balls, that's for sure.
It's in our suite. Champagne and hors d'oeuvres for Bressler and a few of his guests.
Yes. Bressler invited him...
Oh, Jesus... You can't --
Jurgen may have nothing.
I need your help.
Yes, hello, this is Dr. Harris.
.The zoo. She loves Polar Bears. I never knew exactly why.
This shouldn't take long. I just need to see what Bressler wants.
Standing across from her in this protected space. A strange numbness. Doesn't know where to start...
. Liz.
Liz. What's happening?
Why --?: I have to know why, Liz. Are they making you do this? Are they threatening you?
The zoo. The Polar Bears.
You see? I KNOW YOU, Liz. You KNOW me...
You can't what?
Who are they?
My case...?
Cuts up a small path rising up from the Polar Bear area. At the top he turns, hiding himself, looking back.
.Nothing he can do now. He turns away, moves to the top of the path where Gina waits for him. They walk in silence...
The combination. For the lock.
gazing at it. He runs his fingers over its dock-eared corners, every bump and crease. Looks up to find Gina watching him. A long, awkward pause. She reaches over.
.Yes. I'm sorry. Yes. She's my wife. She's in danger. I have to --
No, wait. I meant what I said.
Gina stops, turns. A beat. Sadness, anger.
Rodney? What are you doing here?
Yeah... but how did you know --?
What are -- ?
What the hell Rod! You're my oldest friend! You know who I am. It's me... it's not that other guy. He's not --
No... That's insane. Liz, she----
That's not... she...
But... I... who am I...?
Wait! WAIT!
Is it true...?
Stares down at the wreck. Mind spinning... Gina comes up, touches his shoulder.
. Jurgen... we were going to meet... I have to see him.
I have to!
he told me I'm one of them...
Thank you.
No... No...
No! Leave me alone.
No...
I made him up... I made him up to kill a man I've never met.
Prince Fahad is going to be assassinated today. There's a bomb in the suite. I put it there.
Take this... get out of Berlin.
Take it and go! Get as far away from me as you can.
Look at me. Look at me...
CONTINUED: Gina SPUTTERS, tries to draw air. Her eyes LOCK on his.
.Is this what you want? Is this the person you still want to help.
You should have let me drown...
Pure instinct and adrenaline. Gina grabs the bag, stumbles across the street, HORNS BLARE as cars swerve to avoid her...
You're not listening! There is a bomb, in the Eisenhower Suite. I put it there.
I've told you! There's no time to explain this...
I can prove it. Pull up your lobby recordings from August 27 of this year.
Do it. NOW. Do it or many people will die. I'm not lying.
There! Stop!
Do you see...?
Lily, Laurel...
Bressler's daughters... Lily.
Fahad was never the target. It's Bressler! You have to tell Strauss! They're after Bressler!
Gina1 Gina!
No...
I won't do it...
Bringing the Vun up, pointed at Bressler's head, perfect kill shot. No choice. Finger on the trigger...
Don't. Keep your hands where I can see them. Please...
Let go of the knife, Liz.
Please, just stop, Liz...
His hand going to the knife sunk in his shoulder, SCREAMING in agony as he rips it out, looking up at...
They say your whole life flashes before you... but it's the little things... the details...
Welcome to the Hotel Imperial.
I have to check with the manager.
Your name please?
The professor knows you?
Wait here please.
Everyone says how much it's changed. Berlin.
Yes, me too. I mean, I wouldn't know either. You're American?
For the airport, it's always Americans in the morning...
You do what you do, I do what I do, right?
It's okay. I know what you meant.
I don't drive a taxi.
Okay. Okay. How did you find me?
Do you?
Crazy?

What do you expect me to do? I'm an illegal, driving a taxi without a permit, in an accident without insurance. If the cops catch up with me they'll throw me in jail. If I'm in jail, I lose everything, understand? If I'm in jail, they deport me.
No! It's you who is not listening. You're an American.
No, I don't. What's your name?
Okay, fantastic, you're Martin Harris. You're whoever you say you are. Yes, I picked you up and we crashed. It doesn't mean I know who you are!
What...?
To the airport. Arrivals. You were in a hurry.
You'd have done the same.
Well... I know me. I jump in without thinking. It causes me lot of trouble.
So please. Just leave me alone.
Hey, friend. We're closing...
I thought I told you to --
I know the feeling.
You're married. What about your wife?
It was you. Martin Harris. You.
Don't be an idiot. Come on...
So, how long are you married?
Where did you meet her?
And there's no way she just didn't... recognize you?
Everyone has a story... Where they came from, where they are going, what happened to them.
This is me. 2,259 Euros and counting. The number's the only thing that changes. I reach 4000, I can buy papers...
Or maybe I'll come home one day and find a stranger who claims to be me. I'd like that. Walk away. Leave it all behind.
You could do that.
You see? We're different. You like your memories. very American of you.
Come on...
Slivovic.
The walls are made of cardboard... but it's home.
Don't ask.
The light's bust so you have to leave the door open if you want to see anything. Don't worry, I won't peek.
I give you a place to stay, it doesn't give you the right to --
I should what? Have been an artist? Perhaps in Bosnia...
"Can you imagine what it's like, to wake up one day. And your whole life... has been erased?"
What is it?
You're the best.
Yes, that's right. I sleep with every married American you send my way -- Thank you for that, by the way.
Get on your way! Go!
Just a moment, Biko. And you're going to be late --
Terror-stricken, realizing Martin has abandoned her.
Left --! Turn left...
Left again! Left again! Now right. Here. HERE!
Jesus!
They're going to cut us off!
Come on...
His family is in Africa. The money will just stop coming...
You saved my life.
.You never know, what you will do, until the time comes, right?
Wait here...
.Put these on.
Were you happy?
Your marriage? Was it happy?
So why would she do this to you?
In Bosnia... It was not like you probably imagine. It was nice.
.So I went down to this place I knew, under the small bridge over the creek. And I hid and waited.
It was not enough, to kill us.
What? Raped?
No. No one touched me. But now... I'm not going anywhere.
Liar... Say it again.
.Cool.
We have to go. We have to do what Jurgen said, stay out of --
.No, I don't know, but he stressed it was important.
Why here?
Okay, go. You're going to be late for your date.
They just sat down.
Behind the glass of the penguin exhibit. She saw the kiss.
She's pretty...
He doesn't have any. He was in an accident, that's why the bag was unclaimed...
Can you remember now... how you felt?
We shouldn't stay here, it's not safe for you...
Oh, God. I'm an idiot. She's meeting you here.
That's good. I'm happy for you.

Wait. There's another passenger.
Help me with my bags, please.
Martin...
Martin! Stop! Martin, what's wrong... ? Martin!
We've got to go... leave Berlin.
Martin...?
Listen to me. You're not.
Martin. He's not coming.
She's sorry she's late. She says Jurgen gave it to her. He said that you'd know... that Martin Harris would know what to do...
Herr Jurgen told her to wish you good luck... that it was a pleasure knowing Dr. Harris.
The entry stamp in your passport.
I'm not leaving you! Listen to me: Maybe you're not the man who went into the water. But you are the man I pulled out...
Martin, there's no way you can show your face at the hotel.
Are you serious...? Why don't you ask the Prince?
Sir! Your highness! You're in danger here. There is a bomb in this room!
Professor! Over here!
It's okay, come on...
Seeing Martin and Liz, embracing. Confused. Alarmed. Hurt.
Martin...? Martin?
Also seeing the gun. A hand going out, a scream building...
moves through the crowd, anxiously searching the stream of people still pouring from the building...

Gina moves the taxi mid-stream in the traffic heading onto the bridge. Martin checks his phone, he's got service. He starts to dial...
Achtung!
.A man's voice... distant. German words. Small, faded image of a German DOCTOR, speaking with the nurse...

.again, a pin-hole of consciousness. The Nurse, taking a private moment, speaking in German on her cell-phone. The Nurse looks over, straight at us, realization in her face, she hurries from the room.
Konnen Sie mich horen?
This is Doctor Cole. I'm having an out-of-office experience right now, so... leave a message.
Is that Ernst Jurgen?
My name's Rodney Cole. You left a message on my phone. There were two from Martin as well.
Wenn Sie mich horen konnen, blinken Sie zweimal.
Are you English?
My name is Doctor Farge. You are in the Waldfriede Hospital. I'm the head neurologist here. You have been in an accident.
Can you tell me your name?
Doctor Harris, it's all right.

We didn't find any identification with you, Doctor Harris... the driver, who saved your life, disappeared soon after the accident and no one else has come forward. I must apologize, but we had no idea who you were.
Calm down, Doctor Harris, please.
Can you tell me what you do remember, Martin? Do you remember what day it is?
It's called retrograde amnesia.
-- you have to realize the risk --
-- Let me call the hotel again.
This is my card. Any nausea, dizziness, difficulty with speech, you contact me immediately. Do you understand?
Confusion... memory loss... the complete or partial loss of identity... these are common stages in recovery. Some temporary, others longer term.
The mind is like a jigsaw puzzle.
Comas sometimes perform a kind of alchemy. A patient awakes convinced of a reality that was previously only fantasy.
New men, in effect, with new lives... new loves.
.The man's condition was unusual, yes. But there was nothing to indicate violence.
To someone who threatens that fantasy...? Yes. I believe he is.
The police brought you here. The mistake was mine. I should never have let you leave.
Martin suddenly looks around, struggles to sit up.
Ah. Entpfang... reception...
Excuse me, sir. Do you have an invitation, sir?
Dr. Harris. Do you have any other identification? Passport?
I'm sorry, sir...
If you would be patient, sir.
Excuse me Madam. Your husband is here. He needs to --
You are Dr. Harris?
If you don't leave now, sir, we'll have to call the police.
As you can see... you're not there.
-- but why? Exactly? .Why?
You want us to disturb a Nobel prize winning scientist, simply to attest to your story... when no crime has been committed?
For what? Entering the country legally? Presenting all the correct documentation?
.And sharing a hotel suite with his wife? Excuse me, your wife?
So... now you are saying that you are not Dr. Martin Harris?
But isn't that the suite 'you' are staying in, 'Dr. Harris'...?
.What exactly are you hoping to find?
Sound an alarm. Evacuate the hotel.
You and-you, you're with me.

thread through the crush. Martin ignoring the glances he's getting. His eyes fixed on Liz... her back to him. A glass of wine in her hand... her golden hair... the ivory skin of her shoulders. Strauss taps her on the arm. She half turns...
What's up?
Last time I looked...
Yeah... still me.
Look, You seem like you've had an accident, or perhaps --
Okay, okay. Can you please just get him out of here?
Drakea, named after Anthea Drake, the English botanist who wondered how it manages to reproduce when it doesn't appear to attract any insects...
What the hell are you doing here?
-- how did you get in here? Are you absolutely out of your mind?
oh, Jesus...
No... let me explain. This man showed up at the hotel last night. Security had to remove him. The police were called...
-- seems he checked himself out of the hospital. He was in an accident of some sort.
-- I don't believe it! You've been listening to my calls? Just who the hell are you?
... Laurel, and Lily.

-- to marry scientists. I told you about our honeymoon --

He says he doesn't care if she saved your life... the bitch cost him 20,000 Euros... the insurance won't cover the cab because she had no license... the driver who was letting her moonlight in his taxi, skipped town...
. He says illegal immigrants are destroying German society...
No one knows where she is.
Hey, American. I'm sorry we couldn't help you --
Solomon... Solomon Obiko. My friends just call me Biko.
You got company?
Bring it back to my place. Leave the keys on the TV. And don't forget to reset the meter.
Hey, no need to explain to me.
Hey, while you're at it, check the line to number eight. She's always getting bad service.

Anyway, we're closing until Monday. If you come back then --
You understand, we're not a detective agency, we...

Hey. Martin Harris. Here...
An old friend. He needs work, and he's good at finding things.
It's puzzling, one wonders how --

You know this man?
So what is this? Some sort of hybridized propagation? There are two Martin Harrises?
I thought we might have a table for three, in case you still had your alter ego with you.
Well, it's a lesson. You never know what people will do. All my work used to be on-line, my e-
Now what was so important that it could not wait until this evening?
No! God NO! You're focusing on the science, but this...
.this is history. You open the research before it's finished, the conglomerates gobble it up.
It doesn't matter.
But see you, you say I am too cautious. It's an idiot thing to say. I'm a realist!

Don't be stupid. You can't offend me. We are colleagues, this is good discussion. But please, Dr. Harris -- Power is an animal, all to itself. It adapts, mutates to whatever form will best preserve it. It's always closer than we know.
Look, I probably have it somewhere... Perhaps my wife --
I'm late. Very un-German of me.
Now I can see why somebody would pretend to be Martin.
Separation anxiety. Just leave it there, if you could.
Ah, Mrs. Harris...
I can't help it.
Lily! Lily!
Flickering like a candle in darkness. Suddenly CLOSER.
Hello, Martin. This won't take very long.
We have instruction to move this patient to the American Hospital at Wiesbaden. Here are the papers.
Excuse me, where are you taking this patient?
I'm surprised I wasn't informed... Let me check with --
You two. We need help!. Right now!
COME ON! NOW!
shuffling towards the doors! Given away by the plastic bag and the hospital gown showing under the jacket.
tended by a Middle-Eastern Man who stares at Martin.
Alles in ordnung, Frau Brunner.
Come in. Come in.
Siegler used to work for me.
Sit down...
The Staatssicherheit. The Ministry for State Security.
A true believer, like the rest of us. Now look at him. I should have had him shot.
He forgot. Germans are experts at forgetting. We forgot we were Nazis. Now we've forgotten forty years of Communism. All gone.
But enough of me...
These mean anything to you?
So, they mean something to her.
Her involvement in this. There must have been something... in the past... some indication?
Passport, credit cards, family photos... things like these take time to prepare. You say this man has detailed knowledge of your research, of your relationship with...
Including the fact that you were going to have a random accident that would allow him seamlessly to take your place? These people may be good, but they're not God.
Yes, did you a favor I'd say.

In the Stasi, we had a basic principle: Ask enough questions and a man who is lying will eventually change his story. But a man who tells the truth cannot change his, however unlikely his story sounds. I believe you are telling the truth, Doctor Harris.
I'll start by calling these numbers again... as you say, it's Thanksgiving...
and there's the time difference, so it may take time to make contact. And then there is the question...
Yes. Of money.
Doctor Harris...
A loan against your guarantee.
I'll need twenty-four hours.
Hans. It's Colonel Jurgen. From the old days. I need a favor.
You know, the most dangerous man in the world is the man who feels that he is drowning. He will drag under anyone who tries to help him.
You said you had something.
And what do the numbers refer to?
Not part of your work? Or Professor Bressler's?
Your thesis. The one you sent Bressler. What was the title?
And it was after reading it that he invited you here. Correct?
Did you ever know someone called Laurence Darnell?
He was a graduate student at the University of Wisconsin. He died in an auto accident earlier this year. He was doing research very similar to yours.
What is Professor Bressler's relationship with Prince Fahad?
So they're not close?
But Fahad's just a businessman.
But his progressiveness has cost him... his own people hate him...
There's a cocktail party, before Bressler's speech tonight?
Is Fahad going to be there?
Martin Harris... with just a few guests, in a confined space with Prince Fahad. For some, that might be a very good reason to want to be you.
hears the phone START RINGING again inside his apartment.
Ja ?
Yes, it is.
I appreciate it, Herr Cole...
Dr. Cole... Please, come on in.
Drink? I've a bottle labelled 'brandy', which is more than likely hair lacquer... or some vodka my neighbor gave me after it made her husband go blind.
Maybe some coffee? I'm making some for myself.
The Stasi. In East Germany.
A 'Zil'. Suspension of a donkey cart and smelt like a tannery.
Quite by chance, as it happens.
Come with us to the authorities.
Curiosity...
Professional curiosity. There's not much in this world left to interest an old spy like me...
. a few questions I still think over. One in particular. From when I worked for the Aufklarung: our foreign intelligence wing.
Where would I run from Section 15, Mr. Cole? I can hardly walk.
Before I could get Chesterfields, I smoked sixty machorkas a day.
And then what? We shake hands and you go away?
There's no need for that.
You never think... you'll have the courage to use it.
Tell me... if he remembers everything. What then...?
Moment's thought, Jurgen types Martin Harris Ph.D into the search window. Hits return.
You guys are quick...
. Tumble together, SMASH into the sideboard which collapses, splintering into the kitchen.
Jumps up. Sprints after them. Through the steel door...
Martin and Gina, squeezed together between laughing faces, drunken youth, singing, chanting...
Even darker, only small glowing lights, candles, neon tubing casts shadows. Quiet almost, only the dull 'thud" of the bass reaches them.
Yes, hello, Dr. Harris. This is Else Adlam from Dr. Bressler's office. Dr. Bressler was wondering if you might be able to meet with him today...
August. Three months. That'll be twenty-five Euros.
What are they making you do? Is it about Fahad?

Oh my God... that's unbelievable, the poor man. Well here's the good news -- I've just arrived in Berlin... yes, I've been teaching in Leipzig, at the Hochschule fur Technik. I came up for the last day to hear Bressler's speech...
I'll come right over, it's not far... No, it's no problem.
Herr Jurgen?
No, thank you...
I'm good. Thanks.
You were in the military?
Wow, wait till I tell my son. He loves all that Cold War stuff.
So. This business with Martin.
Sounds like he was damn lucky.
The authorities? Jesus, it's that bad? A guy comes to you with a story like that. What made you take the case?
Curiosity? Is that all?
You had fifteen minutes after I called. Why didn't you run?
I want to know how he found you.
But we do. The best of us.
Jesus, Martin, how are you doing?
You called me, remember? You left a message on my machine.
Stay one step ahead of me. Any move, I'll shatter your spine.
My God... she's right. You're completely gone. You really think you are Martin Harris.
-- Martin Harris? You're right.
Martin Harris doesn't exist. You invented him. He's your legend.
'Liz'...? Your "wife"? How do you think she feels about all this? You two were a good team, then you go and get Norman fucking Rockwell on her.
-- they aren't real memories.
All that studying... planning.
You. You were my best boy.
Look at you now. Nobody. A no-
Caught, the van TEETERING... Sneers at Martin, starts to speak.. Eyes go WIDE as...
Hey, lady. You ready...?
Miss. I ain't got all day.
WHAM! MARTIN LURCHES UP AT GINA! He SLAMS her back against the brick wall, his hand around her neck, cutting off her air, literally lifting her feet off the ground.
The honor is all mine.
But of course. Lily and Laurel are the real reason any of us put up with Leo at all.
I don't think the professor needs an invitation. He is, after all, the reason we are all here.
Same P.O.V. we've seen in Martin's flashes. SMASH CUT...
Where is Herr Strauss...?
Invitation?
LIZ, moving purposefully towards the group, closing, her hand in the unzipped top of the sportsbag slung over her shoulder.
